item.description:
(Southwestern CT) A 3.2 mile hike passing by Pierrepont Lake and includes a loop with a senic view. A wonderful way to endt the day on this first weekend of Fall!

The State Park is touted as haing many different habitats and excellent overlooks on the trails.

We'll meet at the parking area at the main entrance (near the lake, see the park map) by 4:30 PM. There is no fee for parking. The hike is anticipated to take about 2 hours at an easy pace and should be done by about 6:30 PM. A trail map can be found at the park link provided. The hike will follow the White blaze trail out to the Blue trail (in counter-clockwise loop), then a piece of the White trail again up to the Yellow trail. Then down to the White trail and back to the beginning.

Kevin S (http://hiking.meetup....) is leading on this one so please direct questions to him.

Map for parking and trails
http://dep.state.ct.u...

** No parking or park fee **

Directions...
From I-84:
* Take Exit 3 (Route 7 Exit)
* Go south on Route 7, bear right onto Route 35 south
* Follow Route 35 to Route 116 north (see below).

From Ridgefield:
* Go north onto Route 116 for 2.2 miles
* Turn right onto Barlow Mountain Road, which brings you right into Seth Low Pierrepont State Park Reserve.


PETS:
Pets on a leash are permitted in picnic areas and on hiking trails.

For more information, see http://dep.state.ct.u...
